cause.description:
Team in Training is The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society's largest fundraising program. Each participant agrees to raise a certin amount of money for the society in exchange for 4-5 months of training for a marathon, half-marathon, triathalon, or bike race. An estimated 670,950 Americans currently have blood cancers; every nine minutes, someone dies from a blood cancer- that was an estimated 58,300 deaths in 2003 alone. The Society invests $32 million annually in support of more than 200 researchers, provides financial assistance to patients, sponsors scientific conferences around the country, produces educational materials and videos, and runs more than 50 support groups nationwide.
1. The Society is committed to finding cures for blood cancers.
cause.mission: find a cure for leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma.
